English: The submission of La Plata to our enlightened rule has left a great deal of precarious philosophical questions. Let us offer Buenos Aires brotherly advice about the future of South America.
§RGain 4 infamy§! While we already control New Herzegovina, our brothers are still being unrightfully oppressed in the rest of Herzegovina. Proclaim that it is our duty to save them!

§RGain 2 infamy§! Dubrovnik, also known as Ragusa, is an important port inhabited by fellow Slavs. Controlling it would enhance our security in the Herzegovina region and bring economic prosperity. Let us claim it!

§RGain 2 infamy§! The so-called Sanjak of Novi Pazar is not to be split - all of it belongs to the Montenegrins! Though it has been under the Ottoman jackboot since it was conquered from the Serbian Despotate in 1455, the people there know that, deep down, they are true Slavs.

§RGain 2 infamy§! Skadar, also known as Shkodra, Shkoder or Scutari, is an important town on the other side of the lake that carries the same name as the historical capital of our predecessor, the old land of Zeta. While the majority of the town's and the surrounding region's inhabitants are Albanian, controlling it remains paramount in pursuing the resolution of irrigation problems in Old Montenegro. Some have already gone as far as to claim that our future relies on the control of this town. Let us officially stake our claim!
§RGain 6 infamy§! Kosovo was the heartland of the Serbian Empire and we Montenegrins are its true inheritors. Kosovo, the root of Serbian history, tradition and national identity is rightfully ours!
Assume Leadership of the Serbs by Force

§RNOTE: Serbia may retaliate!§! While usually on very friendly terms, the reign of prince and later king Nikola of Montenegro was marked by his struggles with the Serbian Karadordevic and Obrenovic dynasties over the rulership of all Serbs. It was believed locally that Montenegro was the sole remnant and inheritor of the medieval Serbian Empire, from which its restoration will eventually come from. Historically, a dynastic union was almost achieved when a royal marriage between Montenegro and Serbia, that would put the Petrovic-Njegos dynasty in the line of succession, was agreed upon. This was, however, thwarted when the pro-Russian Karadordevic dynasty was restored in Serbia and Russia chose Serbia as its main horse in the race. We can either attempt to proceed peacefully with the royal marriage and a little... accident, or we can simply march to Belgrade and enforce our leadership.

Against all odds, we, the Montenegrins, are now the leaders of the Serbians. However, there are still some cultural differences present between our two people and we must take a stance on the future of our culture...

Ever since the Battle of Kosovo, the Serbian Empire has lain dead at the feet of the Turks. However, one indomitable retreat of Serbs has persisted in the former Zetan land. This retreat became known as Crna Gora - Montenegro. The sole true heir to the Serbian Empire. And now, the house of Petrovic-Njegoš can safely proclaim: the Empire of Dušan is restored! Long live Serbia!

Ever since the Battle of Kosovo, the Serbian Empire has lain dead at the feet of the Turks. However, one indomitable retreat of Serbs has persisted in the former Zetan land. This retreat became known as Crna Gora - Montenegro. And now, from Montenegro, we can safely proclaim: Serbia is restored!

\n\nFollowing a breakdown of diplomatic relations, our brothers in Montenegro have declared themselves as the true rulers of the Serbs and have begun mustering to march on our land with the goal of enforcing their claim. We must ready for war!

The Patriarchate of Pec Monastery is a medieval Serbian Orthodox monastery located near the city of Peja. Built in the 13th century, it became the residence of Serbian Archbishops. In 1346, when the Serbian Patriarchate of Pec was created, the Monastery became the seat of Serbian Patriarchs. The monastery complex consists of several churches, and during medieval and early modern times it was also used as mausoleum of Serbian archbishops and patriarchs. The monastery church is unique in Serbian medieval architecture, with three churches connected as one whole, with a total of four churches. After 1737, the Phanariotes embarked on policy initiatives that led to the exclusion of Serbs in the succession of the patriarchate, which was eventually abolished in September 1766. At the beginning of the First Balkan War, army of the Kingdom of Montenegro entered into Pec. By the Treaty of London, the region of Pec was officially awarded to Montenegro and the Monastery of Pec again became an episcopal seat.

Now that we control Skadar, we have the means to resolve the irrigation issues in Old Montenegro. Diverting water from the large Drin River to our agricultural lands would ensure access to sufficient water for intensive farming to continue even in years with little rain.

Our little brother in the Balkans, Montenegro, sometimes nicknamed "The Serbian Sparta", has humbly requested that we support their endeavors to develop their country and defend against the Turks. Even a small sum of money would be a great boon for the scions of Mount Lovcen. Being a small and mountainous country, Montenegro has few sources of income and would surely be eternally grateful for our support.

Our land is small and poor, making it hard for us to attain prosperity. Luckily, our great protector in the East may be willing to help us out. Let us humbly request Russia's support in our endeavors to develop our country and defend against the Turks. What would only be a small cost to the Russians would be a massive boon to our small country.

Our lord Nikola has had several children, many of which are now ready for marriages. Let us use this opportunity to marry into European royal families and raise our international standing. Prominent proposals include the marriages of king Victor Emmanuel III of Italy with Princess Elena, Serbian pretender Peter Karadordevic with Princess Zorka, Russian Grand Duke Peter Nicolaievich with Princess Milica as well as Prince Franz Joseph of Hesse and by Rhine with Princess Julia.

With the enlargement of our country, our prince has been making various hints at turning Montenegro into a proper Kingdom. With the backing of loyalists in the government, we can arrange for this to happen. Long live the king!

With recent advancements that our country has made, the government has deemed it prudent to create our own currency instead of relying on foreign ones. The Montenegrin Perper, our new currency named after the Byzantine hyperpyron, would be issued using several precious metals, including gold, silver, bronze and nickel, ensuring its stability.
Russia has agreed to subsidy us, for the time being.
Russia has refused to subsidy us this time. Perhaps we should try again later?

Ever in the struggle over the leadership of the Serbian people, our lord Nikola and his advisors have presented a curious scheme: the prince Mirko, duke of Grahovo, will marry Natalija Konstantinovic, a granddaughter of Anna Obrenovic, one of the two competing dynasties in Serbia. By extension, a clause in the marriage agreement will stipulate that were the Serbian monarch Alexander to die with no children, the crown of Serbia will pass exactly to prince Mirko. That way, the house of Petrovic-Njegoš would be the sole ruler of the Serbs. While Mirko is not our firstborn, we could convince the crown prince Danilo to refuse the throne later. Let us send an offer to Belgrade!

\n\nPrince Nikola I of Montenegro has written a patriotic song called "Onamo, 'namo!" (There, o'er there!). The song's music was composed by Franjo Vimer, partly drawing inspiration from the popular "Hymn of Garibaldi". The song's lyrics call for the liberation of Serb-inhabited lands from the Ottoman Empire, making reference to the medieval Serbian capital of Prizren, the Visoki Decani monastery and the 14th-century Battle of Kosovo. This brazen rhetoric coming from the very ruler of Montenegro may anger the Ottoman Empire.
\n\nOur adoption of Onamo 'Namo as our national anthem has apparantly outraged the Turks to such an extent that they have decided to muster their armies against us. We must prepare for war!

\n\nEver in the struggle over the leadership of the Serbian people, the Montenegrin lord Nikola has presented us a curious scheme: his son, prince Mirko, the duke of Grahovo, will marry Natalija Konstantinovic, a granddaughter of Anna Obrenovic. By extension, a clause in the marriage agreement will stipulate that were our lord Alexander to die with no children, the crown of Serbia will pass exactly to prince Mirko. That way, the two Serbian states shall finally be united under one dynasty. Shall we accept?

\n\nThe Montenegrins have published "Onamo, 'namo!" (There, o'er there!), a poem with inflammatory text referencing the killing Turks and the old glory of Serbia, aimed to rouse the Serbs against our rule. It is already hailed as a "Serbian Marseillaise".

\n\nThe Montenegrins have published "Onamo, 'namo!" (There, o'er there!), a poem with inflammatory text referencing the killing Turks and the old glory of Serbia, aimed to rouse the Serbs against our rule. It is not only already hailed as a "Serbian Marseillaise", but the Montenegrins have also had the gall to name this mockery their national anthem!

\n\nOur ruler Danilo I has been assassinated! Todor Kadic of the Bjelopavlici clan that did not recognize his rulership struck as Danilo was boarding a ship at the port of Kotor. Nikola I, Danilo's nephew, has succeeded Danilo as the new prince of Montenegro. After centuries of theocratic rule, Danilo was the first Montenegrin secular prince who did not hold the ecclesiastical position of the Vladika. He was planning to upgrade the status of Montenegro by turning it into a kingdom but did not live long enough to see his ambitions realized.

\n\nGorski Vjenac (The Mountain Wreath) is a poem and a play written by Prince-Bishop and poet Petar II Petrovic-Njegoš. Njegoš wrote The Mountain Wreath during 1846 in Cetinje and published it the following year after the printing in an Armenian monastery in Vienna. It is a modern epic written in verse as a play, thus combining three of the major modes of literary expression. Set in 18th-century Montenegro, the poem deals with attempts of Njegoš's ancestor Metropolitan Danilo I Petrovic-Njegoš to regulate relations among the region's warring tribes. Written as a series of fictitious scenes in the form of dialogues and monologues, the poem opens with Metropolitan Danilo's vision of the spread of Turkish power in Europe. Torn by inner conflict he sees that the struggle is inevitable, but dreads the issues. The poem is considered a masterpiece of Serbian and Montenegrin literature.
\n\nGOur royal marriage has paid off! King Alexander of Serbia has been assassinated without an heir in a coup. Now, the Serbians have elected Mirko Petrovic-Njegoš as the new king!

The tumultuous Montenegrin tribes keep launching raids into our territory, trying to take land for themselves. We shall make them an offer where we give them Iskodra, a part of the Adriatic coast and part of eastern Herzegovina... in exchange for their loyalty. However, Montenegro's allies might not like this!

\n\nAn emissary from the Sultan has presented us a curious offer: wary of the raids we conduct on Ottoman land and our territorial ambition, the Porte offers to give us control of Skadar, a part of the Adriatic coast and a part of eastern Herzegovina... in exchange for bending a knee to Constantinople. How do we reply?

We must unite all of the people of the East Indies under a common banner. Down with the imperialists! 

To take this decision, be, befriend, sphere or conquer §Yall cores§! of the nations of: Djambi, Riau-Lingga, Siak, Aceh, Bone, Yogyakarta, Buton and Bali. Cores of Bali held by Portugal are not counted. Uncolonized cores are not counted.

§GAny nation that has its primary culture in the East Indies cultural group may join as well.§!

\n\nAs war rages on, certain "representatives" of the Czechs and Slovaks have met abroad and signed a declaration uniting their aims of nationhood into a common future state -- a so-called "Czechoslovakia" that they wish to carve up from the corpse of our country!
\n\nWith the success of the Czechoslovak National Council, it must now transform into a provisional government to ensure order in the nation for the time being.

\n\nWith order in the nation secured, we can now establish a regular civil government in Czechoslovakia. Additionaly, a deliberation on how to include the Slovaks on the flag of our new nation has now ended with the success of a modified proposal by Jaroslav Kursa.

\n\nThe Ruthenians -- also called Rusyns, Uhro-Rusins, sometimes Ukrainians and sometimes further divided into subnational groups -- have requested to be included as part of our state, given the foreign claims on their land that they would not be able to resist themselves. In return, they only ask for a certain degree of autonomy to go about their daily lives without persecution.

\n\nNews has reached us about a successful uprising in Pozsony against the efforts of the local government to Slovakize the city. The rebels now request to be integrated into our country. How shall we respond?

\n\nNews has reached us about a successful uprising in Pressburg against the efforts of the local government to Slovakize the city. The rebels now request to be integrated into our country. How shall we respond?

\n\nDespite mishandling the situation enough that an uprising has taken control of the city, the governments of both Hungary and Germany have refused to annex Bratislava and the rebels are now without support. They are now at the mercy of our army.

\n\nOur mishandling of the situation in Bratislava has resulted in an uprising that has taken control of the city! The locals have petitioned to rejoin their former masters, who have accepted - we have lost Bratislava!

Pressburg, Pozsony, Prešporok -- the number of names the Beauty on the Danube has reflects its multiethnic character. Our ministers propose to move the Slovak capital there, as its economic potential as a Danubian port would be a great boon to our country, despite the city's defensive shortcomings. However, the Hungarians and Germans of the city will not like Bratislava cementing its status as a Slovak city. §RIf the unrest in Bratislava will not be dealt with following this move, its non-Slovak citizens will rise up!§W

§GPrevents uprising in Bratislava.§!\n\n"[...] The Bolsheviks stood on the other bank in Petržalka, and in the city itself there were 20,000 organized workers - Bolsheviks and Bolshevik-oriented Hungarian and German social democrats, who were obviously waiting for the arrival of the Hungarians. If they rebelled, the fate of Bratislava would be sealed and the whole government would hang from the lampposts... Now I saw that the Czechoslovak government is at mercy in Bratislava... "You know what?", I said to Brunner, "collect 1,000 people immediately around Bratislava, the leaders of society and leading figures of the city, and send them immediately with escorts to Luhacovice, Terezín and Josefov as hostages. Start immediately, everything must be done by morning." Brunner carried out my order carefully. And when I went for a walk through the city in the morning, there was dead silence everywhere." -Vavro Šrobár

\n\nA new manifesto has been proclaimed at an assembly of about 5,000 Slovaks in Turócszentmárton. It calls for the recognition of Slovaks as their own sovereign nation within Hungary, the creation of an autonomous Upper Hungarian Slovak Land, to be administered by Slovaks through elected representatives, the calls for Slovak to be officially used in affected government offices, courts and schools, and the establishment of a central cultural and scientific institution for Slovaks, Matica Slovenská. What is our response?

\n\n"Marína" is a great work of romantic, reflective and patriotic poetry in Slovak literature, written by Andrej Sládkovic (Andrej Braxatoris), a Slovak Protestant priest, author and translator, between 1844 and 1846, published in Pest in the same year it was finished. The 291 stanzas (2,900 lines) long poem combines themes of unfulfilled love between the author and his student-muse Mária Pišlová with love to one's homeland and author's introspection. The real Mária Pišlová was forced by her mother to marry a rich gingerbread maker instead, which gave Sládkovic's broken heart the impetus to write "Marína". It has now set a new world record for the longest love poem, a position it is sure to keep for many more decades into the future.

\n\nWith the conclusion of our war against Hungary, we are left with an army of Slovak volunteers who are controlled by the Slovak National Council and (despite some friendly fire) loyal to us. What shall we do with them?

\n\nA Slovak cultural institution called "Matica slovenská" was founded in the city of Turciansky Svätý Martin to promote Slovak culture and identity. Inspired by the establishment of the Serbian and Czech Matica, the Slovak Matica established education, research, and publishing programs, laying the foundations for library and archive activities. It drew members from all parts of the nation and, despite being forbidden from getting involved in political activities, became a representative and a symbol of Slovak 'independence'. Gradually, the Matica slovenská became a center of Slovak national life and served as a substitute for national political institutions, which had been prohibited in Hungary. By 1873, the Matica had 1,300 members, many of which included entities such as municipalities, libraries, schools and associations.

§RGain 10 infamy§! The Lands of the Bohemian Crown used to include Silesia, until it was unjustly taken from us by the Prussians. If we are to find a place among the nations of today, we must correct this historical injustice.

§RGain 5 infamy§! Our little brothers, the Lusatian Sorbs, are being cruelly persecuted by the Prussian menace. We must liberate them immediately - lest a Slavic nation will forever be lost in German hell.
A Corridor to the South Slavs

§RGain 7 infamy§! A great migratory injustice in medieval times has divided the Slavs into two unconnected parts. To defend against Magyar irredentism, we must make sure to connect down to Croatia through Burgenland.
A Corridor to the West Slavs

§RGain 7 infamy§! A great migratory injustice in medieval times has divided the Slavs into two unconnected parts. To defend against Magyar irredentism, we must make sure to connect up to Slovakia through Burgenland.

Pressburg, Pozsony, Prešporok -- the number of names the Beauty on the Danube has reflects its multiethnic character. Our ministers propose to move the Slovak capital there, as its economic potential as a Danubian port would be a great boon to our country, despite the city's defensive shortcomings. However, the Hungarians and Germans of the city will not like Bratislava cementing its status as a Slovak city. §RIf the unrest in Bratislava will not be dealt with following this move, its non-Slovak citizens will rise up!§W

\n\nWith our inability to defeat the uprising in Prague, our stranglehold on Bohemia and Moravia has lost its grip as further uprisings across the land, emboldened by the one in Prague, join the cause of Czech nationhood. With the recent unification of these uprisings into a common Czech Congress, Bohemia and Moravia are all but lost.

\n\nWith Vienna's inability to defeat our uprising, their stranglehold on Bohemia and Moravia has lost its grip as further uprisings across the land, emboldened by the one in Prague, join the cause of Czech nationhood. With the recent unification of these uprisings into a common Czech Congress, the Austrian cause is lost.

§RGain 5 infamy. This will disallow you to form Czechoslovakia.§! We Slovaks and Moravians are one nation, with our roots in the Great Moravian Empire of old, as proclaimed by the great romanticist historians of our age. We must reject foreign influences on our national outlook, such as with the Germanized Bohemians, and set sights back, to our ancient times of glory. We are the heirs to Great Moravia!

§RGain 20 infamy.§! We have retaken the ancient cores of Svätopluk's empire: Moravia and Nitra. But to retain our independence and strength in the faces of German and Magyar aggressors, we must push onward - what was once ours, will be ours again!

§RGain 25 infamy.§! Europe has been shook by the scions of Mojmír - yet the studies of our eminent historians claim yet further extents of our ancient empire, from Lusatia down to the Tisa, from Krems down the Pannonian March to present Croatia. They may call us mad all they want - deal the final blow to cement our hegemony over Central Europe!
\n\nWe have successfully managed to defeat the Czechs with a final bombardment of the rebels in Prague's Old Town. Their cause is subdued for the time being and we can focus our attention elsewhere.
We hold the core of the White Ruthenian nation, yet there are more of us beyond our borders, shackled and oppressed by foreign powers. If our nation is to truly awake, it must be whole!

The government in Washington has created the Indian Territory to be the land where we may live without the intrusions of colonists. However, greed compelled the pale face to chip away at this territory at any time he deemed it beneficial for himself. Justice compels us to remind him of the original promise he made to us!

It was not so long ago that the tribes south of the Great Lakes confederated to resist American expansion. In the end, our people have lost and were expelled further west. But - the heirs to these warriors now live among us and with our newfound strength they clamor: let us take revenge - let us head home east!

All land west of the Appalachians has been reserved for us in 1763 by the British. However, the pale faces has broken this promise in his everlasting greed and poured west into our lands. No more! He shall be reminded of the wrongs he has done to our peoples.
The Seminole, a part of our confederation, have been driven from their lands in Florida. With our rising strength, calls mount to reclaim this land - let us heed them!
The Final Push to the Sea

Four hundred years ago, the pale faces landed at our shores and brought doom. Our ancestral land he took from us by war and trickery, every treaty he broke and every tribe he affected by his mischief. However, the tides of fortune have turned in the recent years and we now stand ready to finish what we started. We shall reach the east coast!

If we are to compete with the Europeans, we must do everything in our power to raise our population. We must force tribes to settle down, grow crops and keep animals. We must regulate rivers, clear land and protect settlements. Our youth will attend foreign universities to learn about medicine, agriculture and other useful things. Polygamy will have to be legally expanded to all constituent nations and all families will have to be accounted for. It will take much money, effort and debate in the Tribal Council, but in the end, there is no other option for us if we want to have a future.

Now with enough people and food, we can begin the second part of our program. We will start the construction of proper permanent towns across the land to serve as hubs of administration, commerce and learning, from which our nations can spring up stronger than before. At the same time, we shall continue with our previous policies in the countryside.

The towns have been build and the countryside teems with people. Our nations spread across the land, connecting it with newfound wealth it has given them. The rise of quality of life coupled with new advancements in medicine offers us the opportunity to encourage one last population boom.
Colonizers are no longer welcome to settle in our ancestral lands.
Constant revolts and mutinies are making our country less attractive for immigration.
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
Expel Settlers from the Great Lakes
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
Expel Settlers from the West, North and South
All those who have unlawfully or by trickery seized our lands must leave our Confederacy within 30 days. What they cannot take with them shall be seized.
With control over the homeland of the Cherokees restored, many have expressed the will to return back.
With control over the homeland of the Seminoles restored, many have expressed the will to return back.
With control over the homeland of the Kickapoos restored, many have expressed the will to return back.
With control over the homeland of the Choctaws restored, many have expressed the will to return back.
With control over the homeland of the Caddos restored, many have expressed the will to return back.
Return of the Lower Mississippi Tribes
With control over the homeland of the lower Mississippi tribes restored, many have expressed the will to return back.

Our peoples have been expelled from the banks of the Mississippi and their descendants now pressure the council to lay claim to these territories. Let us therefore march back east and take what's ours!
There are still brothers of ours that dwell in the land where the Mississippi flows into the sea. We shall head south and liberate them - and no longer be landlocked!

After some deliberation, the council has presented a number of places suitable for our future new capital. Most argue for a site along the Mississippi, which would help faciliate trade and communication along this great artery. Others would favor a plot around the Great Lakes for similar reasons, or romantic idealism tied to the two previous rebellious confederacies in the area. Which site shall we choose?

§RDo not move your capital to a province you do not control.

Ensure your new capital's region is not a colony state, or you will suffer greatly!§!

For our confederacy to be able to truly organize, we must settle on a favorable new capital to house our administration in perpetuity and to be in good access to all the lands we administer. Let us call together the great minds of the land and let them deliberate. §BThey will offer a plan within thirty days.§!

\n\nWe have picked a site for our new capital and now we must decide on a name for it. We may choose to honor someone great from our past, give it a descriptive name, or simply keep the name formerly used for the territory. Which shall we pick?

Due to many previous experiences in the past, settlers were no longer welcome in our lands. However, now that our population has greatly risen and we have established proper administration throughout the country, some voices are beginning to debate allowing settlement. They claim that we would now have the means to control this influx properly and that many of our great leaders have already had European ancestry. A set of laws would have to be passed on various levels of the government, but in the end, it is all up to us. Shall we reopen our land for settlement?

If we are to truly become a modern nation with the strength to push against the world, we must unify our country culturally. From the sea through the highlands to the Oromo desert, all must learn and speak Amhara - no other language shall be permitted in official use and this policy will be enforced by means learned from the French and Japanese. Ethiopia is Amhara!

If we are to truly become a modern nation with the strength to push against the world, we must unify our country culturally. From the sea through the highlands to the Ogaden desert, all must learn and speak Oromo - no other language shall be permitted in official use and this policy will be enforced by means learned from the French and Japanese. Ethiopia is Oromo!

Since the white man arrived in America, he pushed us constantly in our home, putting the seeds of division amongst us, dividing and conquering us whenever he got the opportunity. No more we, the owners of the Turtle Island, will be pushed by the outsiders as they see fit. The time has come to release the shackles of our brothers on the West Coast and unite ourselves as a single entity against the white man for the final crusade.

After centuries of humiliation and yoke, the Ottomans have at last been expelled from Constantinople. The ripples that our triumphal reconquest creates shall be felt in every Orthodox household and in every palace of the Great Powers. Thus let us rightfully seize the moment and declare a new Christian empire in Constantinople - the Bulgarian Empire!
Reclaim the Lost Lands of the Commonwealth

§RGain 5 infamy§! The Commonwealth is again on the world map, and with that comes a new wave of irredentism. Prussia, Inflanty and the governorates of the east must be taken back from the greed of Berlin and the perfidy of Muscovy, lest they descend upon us like vultures again!

§RGain 12 infamy§! As the Commonwealth enters a new era, so does our populace pick up its new ideas. Calls of nationalist Poles and Lithuanians mount to save our oppressed countrymen in Silesia and Lithuania Minor, who the Germans aim to turn into one of them through force. We must save them before it's too late!

§RGain 8 infamy§! With the recognition of the Ruthenians as the third pillar of our Commonwealth, their culture has flourished. Many now clamor for the rescue of their brethren still under the boot of foreign powers - those in Smolensk, on the old Wild Fields and even across the Carpathians. Let us embrace these claims and show the powers that partition how strong we have gotten!

Livonia - that is Estonia, Inflanty and Courland - has been under Swedish and Russian control for the last two centuries, with both countries having marginalized the native peoples there. Our country, however, is a just and noble claimant to this land - and we shall prove it through granting equal rights to the people who inhabit it!

With the Commonwealth reborn from the grave, the Ruthenians once again live robbed of their full rights. Sympathizers in the government have proposed the creation of a third, Ruthenian territory, in which the locals will be free to govern themselves in their native tongue as equal peoples to the Poles and Lithuanians. Further proposed amendments of the constitution will cement their status as the newest integral part of our state, free of oppression. The reform pack will transform our Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth into the Polish-Lithuanian-Ruthenian Commonwealth. Long live the new Commonwealth!

\n\nWith fire and sword have we brought deluge to our enemies - from Berlin in the west to Moscow in the east, from the Baltic in the north to the fire in the steppe of the south. Poles, Lithuanians and Ruthenians stand proudly in their liberated homeland and no foreign power can take it from them again. In a landmark conference held in London, the former partitioning powers have begrudgingly agreed to disavow their land grabs of 1772 onwards and to formally recognize the borders we held prior.§Y The feeling, however, is that the tide of nationalism will never fully allow the Germans to rescind their claims on the German-majority coast connecting Berlin to Prussia.§! But for now, we can say - we have not perished yet!

\n\nContrary to the popular saying that the Bourbons never forget and never learn, our dynasty has managed to learn from its past mistakes and has fully embraced the spirit of reformist progress. With the unprecedented liberty and social security we have offered to our people, coupled with the reduction of the royalty to a purely ceremonial status, many must admit that there is little anger to remain against the sons of Henri IV.
What have the Bourbons ever done for us?

\n\nAs the constitutional convention proceeds, the debate has now fallen to the level of democracy in our country. Some argue for extended freedoms - others, cautioned by the split between the Liberals and the Conservatives, propose limited measures. Some go even as far as demanding the abolishment of elections or the end of the Church. How shall we proceed?
\n\nWith such a monumental civil war ended, we now have the option to constitutionally enshrine a new national value and pursue it across the land. Which would fit our future the best?

\n\nWith our emphasis on stability, some voices have suggested crowning a monarch to transcend the fracturing we have suffered. While unusual for the New World and thus with opposition, we have already experienced a local monarchy under Mexico and Brazil has opted for a monarchy as well. What would be the best course of action for our future?

After managing to stay united as a single country, we can now start focusing on rebuilding, getting stronger and make use of the military experience acquired from these separatist revolts in order to become a stronger nation, as well as start pumping up our economic reforms in the short term.
Our people are voicing unrest at the recent changes in our national politics.
Found a New Empire in Central Asia

The Lion and the Bear wish to hunt on our land. Have they no shame as they gaze upon the cities of the Silk Road, the homes of philosophers and mathematicians? Have they no fear as they tread on the spirits of Genghis Khan and Amir Timur? Let them know that a new Ghazi arises - last of the Great Conquerors - the final Empire in Central Asia.

With a great feat of arms we have established our new empire. A myriad nations bow before our most radiant throne. We now stand before a crossroads - a crossroads that will define the very basis of our empire.

Are we content with being a strong buffer between the empires of Russia and Britain, prioritizing art and culture before conquest? Or shall we set our sights towards Persia: to establish a new dynasty there, as many before us did? Perhaps it would be more prudent to instead set the steppe and taiga ablaze, to expel the Russians back to Europe and restore the great Sibir to its natives? Shall we even perhaps set our sights to liberate the Muslims of Hindustan and establish a new dominion there, much like Babur did? Or are we simply conquerors and plunderers, seeking to enrich and embellish ourselves, as was Tamerlane's right?

Choose well, o Emperor, for your choice shall resonate around the world...
A new renaissance is upon our people.
I am Jamshid, I am Khosrow, I am Rostam and Fereydun.
Genghis Khan is clearly listed in my family tree here.
Babur, guide my sword against the perfidious!
Oh Prophet, make war upon infidels and unbelievers, and treat them with severity...

We have chosen to eliminate the Russian threat to Central Asia and push them all back behind the Urals.

§RWe have to act quickly, as in about thirty years, none of our uncontrolled claims will be still recognized - rather laughed at.§!

Two generations have passed and the pledge of our founder to expel the Russians out of Asia has dissipated.

§RWhat claims we have not taken up to this point are no longer recognized as valid.§!
\n\nOh Padishah, oh Ruler of the World! Our rightly-guided armies have seized the great city of Delhi, seat of the former Mughal Empire. Shall the court relocate to this beating heart of India?

Iran has fallen to our armies! Its splendor is now yours to command, oh Shahanshah. Will your new dynasty settle in one of the splendorous cities of the region?

§RMake sure you own the city you choose or your administrators will get a great headache!§!
Culture and thought flourish under our new empire.
Our resolve to push the Russians back beyond the Urals is still respected.
The Sepoys have been victorious and the British are now powerless to hold onto India. Let us send them a formal message demanding their official withdrawal from the subcontinent.

\n\nYour Majesty, times are changing and our Empire now has the need for not only personal banners and merchant flags, but also an official state flag. Bernhard Karl von Koehne, the head of the Heraldry Department of the Governing Senate, proposes a black-gold-white flag derived from the Imperial Coat of Arms. Another option would be to officialize the de facto used white-blue-red civil ensign. Which option would Your Majesty prefer?
Sign the decree on the new heraldic flag.
Sign the decree on the old civil ensign.

\n\nThe black-yellow-white flag existed as an official flag for almost 25 years - however, on 28 April 1883, the edict "On flags for decorating buildings in solemnities" was issued. It allowed to use only white-blue-red flags to decorate buildings. Shall we expand this edict to make the white-blue-red flag the official flag of Russia again?

\n\nThe heraldic or black-gold-white imperial flag has never enjoyed much popularity, yet murky legislation ensures it still flies on certain places. Upcoming grand festivities this year give us the opportunity to finally settle this issue and completely settle on a flag that will surely never change.
White, blue and red will be fully used again.
Unshakably decree the usage of the heraldic flag!

William III, King of the Netherlands and Grand Duke of Luxemburg has died today at the age of 73. The king was a man of immense stature and with a boisterous voice. He could be gentle and kind, then suddenly he could become intimidating and even violent. An autocrat at heart, he was inclined to terrorize and humiliate his courtiers and was cruel to animals as well. Most people around him agreed that he was, to some degree, insane.

All of the late king's sons have preceded him to the grave. The succession laws were thus changed three years ago and now his underage daughter Wilhelmina succeeds to the throne in a regency. However, Luxemburg does not permit female succession. Adolf of Nassau-Weilburg, the closest male relative, now becomes the Grand Duke of an independent Luxemburg.

Marie Louise of the house of Habsburg-Lorraine, duchess of Parma, Piacenza and Guastalla, former wife of Napoleon Bonaparte and the mother of his only legitimate son, has died at the age of 56 of pleurisy. Charles II of Bourbon-Parma, duke of Lucca and previously the king of the Napoleonic client kingdom of Etruria, has now very reluctantly accepted the inheritance of the late Empress. It is expected that he will abdicate once he has secured the duchy for his heirs.

The accession of the house of Bourbon-Parma provides a prudent opportunity to change the flag of our duchy and make us more recognizable. The newly proposed flag is attached to the top of this document. Shall we proceed with the change or not?
What a spin on flag design!
That flag looks too radical! Denied, arrested, executed!
The Patriarchate of All Slavs and the Prince-Bishopric of Montenegro

The Europeans like to "claim" that "land" is theirs. Most curious! We shall embrace this concept to fit in with the rest of the civilized countries. Mosquitia's natural borders shall be, say... from here to here? Fetch me a pencil posthaste, my good sir! And the good parchment!

\n\nAs we have now found ourselves at war with the English, the continued use of the Union Jack on our flag has given way to impracticalities of combat as well as public opposition. An official change to our flag is now simply a necessity.

\n\nWith the recent unification of Italy, confusion is abound regarding the national flag. Some are seen flying Savoyard banners and a foreign match company has even printed them on their boxes as our official flag! We should make it clear that we have but one flag of Italy: it is the one with our ancient and complex dynastic achievements right in the middle.

\n\nThe current international situation of Hawai'i has made the similarity of our flag to that of Britain a problem of increasing proportions. Advisors suggest that it would be prudent if we avoided any future faux pas by adopting the personal flag of Your Majesty as the state flag of our kingdom, Union Jack gone.

\n\nThe Serbs of Vojvodina have successfully campaigned against the treasonous Hungarians and now stand at peace. Despite their apparent loyalty to our most illustrious house, perhaps it would still be prudent to quickly reintegrate them before they decide to join Serbia down south...

\n\nAfter our victory against the Hungarians, the Austrians now seek to regain control over Vojvodina. We did, in fact, fight more or less in the name of the emperor who now promises us our own crownland, but perhaps unification with Serbia would be preferable regardless...

As our power has been greatly diminished, growing voices now clamour for the independence of Wales to further our demise. A disaster of such proportions would leave fair old England in a most rumpuous position, a laughing stock of Europe, far behind even the dreadful Hibernian. To regain momentum, perhaps it would be prudent to call upon the glory of the Tudors and the majesty of Arthur - to find a compromise and create a new United Kingdom: that of England and Wales.

Since 1453, the Turks have defiled the greatest Orthodox city, enslaved our brethren and forced the Patriarch to do the bidding of their Sultan. No more! As $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers triumphantly enter the heart of Rome in the East, there is but one thing to do: proclaim a new empire in the name Christ Pantokrator.

Estabilished after the Greater Northern War, the three Baltic governorates - Livonia, Estland and Courland, after years of Russian rule, have shared the same governor since 1800, despite technically still being separate. If we were able to project enough power in our governorates, we might be able to de facto control all of them, despite the reality on paper being different. But who knows? Perhaps the Tsar would be partial to allow this fait accompli...

\n\nAdquired after the Great Northern War and Partition of Poland, the three Baltic governorates - Livonia, Estland and Courland, despite technically being separate, have shared the same governor since 1800. It seems that the current governor has managed to assert his authority enough that any divisions remain but on paper. Now, he is requested that the administration of his governorships be reformed and unified into a single entity. While this would allow them to better administer the region, we are advised that it could be dangerous to allow this show of ambition to succeed, especially if we were to try to russify and integrate the region in the future. Do we allow the governorates to be merged into one entity, or do we replace the governor with a less ambitious man?
The Baltic German Plea For Help

\n\nAn envoy has arrived from Riga under mundane pretext - in reality bearing a serious message. It would seem that, with our ascendency in the world stage, the Russians fear that if their loyalty was tested, the Baltic Germans would turn their loyalty to a German invader rather than their Russian overlords. Now they are consering to end the Ostsee Rights, close the German Landtags and directly incorporate the Baltic Governorates, perhaps even to subject them to Russification. The envoy asks for help - for the Germans to protect their own shall Russia try to deprive them of their rights. A secret treaty can be drafted... What is our response?

It is becoming more and more probable that the Tsar will decide to abolish our governorate and administrate us directly. In such an event, we would be nigh powerless to resist the Russian onslaught. Our only hope would be to sign a secret treaty with our German brothers in Berlin - that they would come defend us from Russian aggression. We cannot let ourselves become lost!
\n\nThe Russians have decreed our governorate forfeit - the lands are henceforth to be administered directly as a part of Russia. We may accept - or we may resist...

\n\nThe arrogant Balts led by their treacherous German landowners have, upon hearing news of our proclamation of integration, declared independence, capturing Russian officials and taken control over the Baltic Provinces!

\n\nPer the secret treaty we have signed with the Baltic Germans, they now ask for our help against the Russians, with Russian officials being captured by German and Baltic militias, as skirmishes already mark the beginning the Baltic fight for independence! Shall we honor the treaty?

\n\nDire news! Apparently, our worst fears have proven true! The Baltic government has signed a secret defense treaty with Berlin against us - and now German troops march east to protect their Baltic brethen!

\n\nAs the dust settles, we begin to transition our provisional government to a more permanent one. For quite some time now, there have been debates in Riga about the future of our nation and there even envoys from Germany going around and helping decide on what would be best for the Baltic. Today, the most proeminent figures of the Baltic Provinces gather in Riga to finally decide upon how will be governed from now on. First, we could crown a monarch, the Grand-Duke of Mecklenburg-Schwerin and representative of the German entourage as our new head of state. We could also opt to empower the local Landtags while having no monarch, becoming something of an eastern Switzerland. Finally, our generals would be willing to help solidify our new country - temporarily, of course. We shall decide soon, as the crowd outside grows more and more unruly by the day, with talks of curtailing German influence turning into a threat our government.

Erekle II, the king of Kartli and Kakheti, has requested our protection back in 1783, to which we have most magnanimously agreed by signing the Treaty of Georgievsk. However, since the Georgians have been unable to defend themselves properly against the Persians, even after our garrison has left Tbilisi, our gracious sovereign Peter I has decreed to directly annex the kingdom in 1801. Now that the Persians have been beaten back, perhaps it would be prudent to re-uphold the treaty and restore our loyal servant and chamberlain, the prince Bagrat, son of George XII, in Kartli-Kakheti, instead of relying on the unpopular viceregal administration? A strong and loyal native state would, after all, be a beneficial buffer zone between the Ottoman and Persian empires...

§RAvailable until 1837!§! Ever since the year 1465 there has been no king of a united Georgia. We have been fragmented into numerous bickering branches and used by various foreign powers. It is only as if through a divine miracle that Russia even decided to restore the Treaty of Georgievsk. If we want to become a strong state, we must resolve the ancient succession issues. The princes (batonishvili) are unfortunately too numerous to be killed off - it appears that the only option would be to pay them generous compensations and establish some sort of a set legal framework for their positions within the court and administration. Finally, we should get formal recognition from our overlord to confirm our rulership over all Georgia, which would also enable us to slowly absorb the fiefdoms in the west. The whole endeavor will be costly, but it is necessary. For a united Georgia!
We are paying off the myriad Bagratid princes in return for the recognition of our branch as the first kings of all Georgia since George VIII in 1465.
Found the Society for the Spreading of Literacy Among Georgians

The Society was a charity founded by the noblemen Ilia Chavchavadze, Dimitri Kipiani, and local educators like Iakob Gogebashvili and Mariam Jambakur-Orbeliani in May 1879 in order to promote a cultural renaissance among the peasantry of Georgia. The Society ran a network of schools, bookshops and libraries throughout the country, trained teachers, and sponsored Georgian-language journals and magazines. Prince Chavchavadze, a prominent writer, went on to play a leading role in the Society, succeeding the first chairman Kipiani in 1885 until his assassination in 1907. In 1885, the Mingrelian prince Niko Dadiani donated his father's rich personal library collection, including old Georgian manuscripts, to the charity. The organization involved virtually all active Georgian men of letters, several philanthropists and officials, and was instrumental in Georgian national revival in the latter half of the 19th century.
The Patriarchate of All Slavs and the Prince-Bishopric of Montenegro
